column4: how come when I boot into cd and use sudo chmod +x /etc/init.d/rc and then I see the file is execute and then when I reboot it still say that the file is not booting up and I can't boot up the machine?
run it manually, chmod +x it and then do /etc/init.d/blah start
you hae to redo it every time you reboot...cuz the cd is read only :)
what do you mean by run it manually?
just do /blah/blah/blah/thefileyouchmoded and that will execute it
you run it yourself after making it executable vs rebooting
just boot the cd like normal, then when you get in and after you chmod the file you can manually execute the file to start whatever service you were trying to start
can you give me step by step, I am kind of new, sorry =(
you havent even told us what you are trying to do
ok so boot the cd, mount your root partition mount /dev/??? /mnt/blah;  and then chmod +x /mnt/blah/etc/init.d/rc
yay thanks, it works =) but I have a question, how come I don't see the /mnt folder in ubuntu cd even after I show all hidden files, is it just there?
i have no idea...they must be protecting people from discovering /mnt
i only use the console for my file management...so no
